question.text: In the radioactive decay of <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></mrow></msup></math> , which of the following could be considered as incorrect statement?

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">α</mi><mo>-</mo></math> decay involves the decrease of both <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> by <math><mn>2</mn></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">β</mi><mo>-</mo></math> decay involves the increase of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> by one, <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> remaining constant

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi><mo>-</mo></math> electron capture results in the decrease of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> by one with no change in A and emission of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">γ</mi><mo>-</mo></math> rays

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">γ</mi><mo>-</mo></math> ray emission is followed by the emission of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">α</mi></math> or <math><mi mathvariant="normal">β</mi><mo>-</mo></math> particles

solution.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">α</mi><mo>-</mo></math> decay involves the decrease of mass number i.e. <math><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> by <math><mn>4</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"></mi><mi mathvariant="normal">u</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi></math> and atomic number i.e. <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> by <math><mn>2</mn></math> unit.
